listeningQuestion.question: What is the Statue of Liberty?

editorNotes: 本课讲述了自由女神像的历史背景和建造过程。文章重点介绍了这座雕像的建造细节、运输过程和象征意义。语法上主要涉及被动语态的使用，以及一些重要短语如'take to pieces'和'put together'的用法。

dialogueText.heading: 课文
notes: One of the most famous monuments in the world, the Statue of Liberty, was presented to the United States of America in the nineteenth century by the people of France.
The great statue, which was designed by the sculptor Auguste Bartholdi, took ten years to complete.
The actual figure was made of copper supported by a metal framework which had been especially constructed by Eiffel.
Before it could be transported to the United States, a site had to be found for it and a pedestal had to be built.
The site chosen was an island at the entrance of New York Harbour.
By 1884, a statue which was 151 feet tall had been erected in Paris.
The following year, it was taken to pieces and sent to America.
By the end of October 1886, the statue had been put together again and it was officially presented to the American people by Bartholdi.
Ever since then, the great monument has been a symbol of liberty for the millions of people who have passed through New York Harbour to make their homes in America.

translation.heading: 翻译
notes: 世界上最著名的纪念碑之一的自由女神雕像是在19世纪时由法国人民赠送给美国的。
这座由雕像家奥古斯特·巴索尔地设计的巨大雕像是用10年时间雕刻成的。
这座雕像的主体是用铜制成的，由艾菲尔特制的金属框架支撑着。
在雕像被运往美国之前，必须为它选好一块场地，同时必须建造一个基座。
场地选在了纽约港入口处的一个岛上。
到1884年，一座高度达151英尺的雕像在巴黎竖立起来了。
第二年，它被拆成若干小块，运到美国。
到1886年10月底，这座雕像被重新组装起来，由巴索尔地正式赠送给美国人民。
从那时起，这座伟大的纪念碑对通过纽约港进入美国定居的千百万人来说就一直是自由的象征。

notes.title: 被动语态
content: 本课大量使用被动语态，表示动作的承受者。
例如：was presented, was designed, was made, had been constructed等。
被动语态强调动作的承受者，而不是执行者。

notes.title: 现在完成时
content: 表示从过去某一时刻开始一直持续到现在的动作或状态。
例如：has been a symbol of liberty
常与ever since then等时间状语连用。

notes.context: 用于描述将物体拆解的过程
notes.example: The machine was taken to pieces before being transported.

notes.context: 用于描述将零件组装成完整物体的过程
notes.example: The statue was put together again in New York.
Many immigrants made their homes in America.

multipleChoice.question: Who designed the Statue of Liberty?
multipleChoice.explanation: 文中提到这座雕像是由雕刻家奥古斯特·巴索尔地设计的。

notes.title: 文化背景
notes.content: 自由女神像是法国赠送给美国的礼物，象征着自由和民主。它不仅是纽约的标志性建筑，也是美国自由精神的象征。这座雕像的设计和建造过程展示了19世纪工程技术的成就。
